title: Russian Critics Speak Out, Prompted by Ukraine Losses
description: Ukraine’s recent battlefield successes are emboldening Vladimir Putin’s critics and sending his supporters in search of someone else to blame.

title: Ukraine’s Sudden Gains Prompt New Questions for Commanders
description: Ukraine’s military is gauging how far its forces can press the attack, at risk of their ability to hold the new lines. Russian leaders are trying to regroup after a dramatic, demoralizing rout.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Ukraine’s Advance Continues
description: Plus former British colonies weigh their relationship with the monarchy and Lebanon faces blackouts.

title: What to Expect as Britain Mourns Queen Elizabeth
description: Her funeral is scheduled for Sept. 19. Before that, there are processions, vigils and four days of lying in state in London.

title: Biden Will Attend Queen Elizabeth II’s Funeral. Putin Will Not.
description: Heads of state and royalty from around the world are expected to attend the funeral on Sept. 19.

title: A Day Steeped in Ancient Tradition for a New King
description: King Charles III addressed Parliament in London, then flew to Scotland for a service of thanksgiving for his mother.

title: From Policy to Pageantry: Prime Minister Liz Truss’s Dizzying First Week
description: Ms. Truss took over a British government facing an economic emergency. But those problems have been eclipsed by the queen’s death, an epochal event that has put politics on hold.

title: At 75, the Father of Environmental Justice Meets the Moment
description: The White House has pledged $60 billion to a cause Robert Bullard has championed since the late seventies. He wants guarantees that the money will end up in the right hands.

title: Ukraine’s Sudden Success Could Bolster Europe’s Support — and Morale
description: “It’s not for nothing.” Ukraine’s backers say that an offensive over the weekend shows Western military aid is helping, and that it’s time to supply more sophisticated weaponry.

title: Losses in Ukraine Prompt Debate on Russian TV
description: The divergence of views, even on tightly-controlled state television networks, highlighted how Moscow’s narrative had quickly shifted.

title: What Is a Constitutional Monarchy?
description: Even without a written constitution, Britain follows laws and carefully documented traditions that together bind the king.

title: The Horse Whisperer and Queen Elizabeth
description: A renowned American horse trainer described his three-decade-long friendship with Queen Elizabeth II, and the time she called him, unexpectedly, at 2:30 a.m.

title: Ukraine’s backers say the offensive shows Western aid is ‘not for nothing.’
description: The Ukrainian military’s recent successes will most likely increase the pressure on countries like Germany to give more sophisticated weapons.

title: New Zealand’s Leader Affirms Support for a Republic, but Not Now
description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern previously said King Charles III had “consistently demonstrated his deep care for our nation.”

title: How Long is the Drive to the Edge of the Universe?
description: See you in a quadrillion years or so. Don’t forget to pack zillions of tons of snacks!

title: Oppressive Blackouts Force Lebanese to Change Rhythm of Life
description: With electricity coming on at random times, and for only an hour or two a day, residents have had to find coping strategies — including doing laundry and charging everything they can after midnight.

title: U.N. Agency in Talks With Russia and Ukraine to End Fighting at Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant
description: The nuclear complex in southern Ukraine has been imperiled by frequent shelling, raising fears of a nuclear catastrophe.

title: Prince Andrew Will Join Queen’s Memorial Ceremonies in Civilian Dress
description: The palace said the prince, largely exiled from public life over his ties to the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, would mourn his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, in civilian clothes.

title: U.K. Updates: Thousands Gather to Pay Respects to the Queen in Scotland
description: Queen Elizabeth II’s coffin will be moved from the royal residence in Edinburgh to the city’s St Giles’ Cathedral. Earlier, King Charles III addressed Britain’s Parliament for the first time as monarch.

title: Ukraine Live Updates: Northeast Offensive Claims More Ground
description: Russia acknowledged the loss of almost all of the Kharkiv region, a stunning setback. Ukraine’s Western backers cheered the gains but warned that Moscow could retaliate with long-range attacks.

title: Pro-Putin Candidates Sweep Russia’s Local Elections
description: The elections were an early test of whether the upheaval caused by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has affected voters.

title: Are the Polls Wrong Again?
description: Are Democrats again about to be disappointed by overly optimistic polling?

title: Prince Harry Pays Tribute to ‘Granny’
description: In his first public comments since the death of his grandmother, the prince said she was already “sorely missed.”

title: Anti-Monarchists Tread Lightly After Queen’s Death, but Their Goal Persists
description: King Charles III is less popular than his mother, offering republican campaigners their best chance of momentum in years. But they risk offending mourners by moving too soon.

title: Cracking the Case of the Giant Fern Genome
description: Scientists have sequenced complete fern genomes for the first time, to learn why the plants have twice as much DNA as humans.

title: Russian Strikes Cause Blackouts as Ukraine Gains in Northeast
description: Kyiv condemned the strikes as an act of revenge as Russian forces retreat in the northeast.

title: Monkeypox Shots, Treatments and Tests Are Unavailable in Much of the World
description: High-income countries snapped up vaccines when the disease hit them, leaving none for countries that have battled the virus for years, in an echo of the Covid response.

title: The Cartoonist Kate Beaton Found Humor, and Humanity, in Canada’s Oil Fields
description: Kate Beaton headed to the tar sand fields of Alberta saddled with loans and in need of cash. She found a job — and the book she “was always going to make.”

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: An embarrassing Russian retreat.

title: Sweden’s Divisive Election Is Too Close to Call, Officials Say
description: The tight race capped a campaign that analysts called unusually aggressive, with the nationalist, right-wing Sweden Democrats increasingly popular.
